topic_set_details.materiality_evidence: The teaching addresses a dispositive procedural incident (failure to notify an auditor's report) requiring the procedure to be restarted so parties can file the final mémoire.
The ruling interprets and applies the Règlement général de procédure and is handed down by the Conseil d'État, engaging administrative procedure law directly.
The remedy ordered is to grant parties a specific time limit to submit the last mémoire (article 14(2)), so deadlines are central to the holding.

retrieval_info.description: Use set intersection for retrieval: match sources where topic_set ∩ query_topics ≠ ∅ AND issue_type_set ∩ query_issue_types ≠ ∅
retrieval_info.retrieval_queries: Researchers will search for decisions about missing notification of an auditor's/rapporteur's report, remedies requiring reprise de la procédure, and the issuance of a time limit to file the final mémoire under article 14(2) of the Règlement général de procédure.

rejected_topics.rejection_reason: Privacy/data protection topics are not engaged by this procedural, administrative decision.

rejected_issue_types.rejection_reason: Factual question about whether notification occurred is background to the remedial teaching but the teaching does not provide actionable guidance on factual proof or assessment methods.
The decision reaches a remedial conclusion rather than analysing the legal elements of a breach; inclusion of breach as a separate issue type would be redundant given procedural/remedy focus.

stage1_concepts: right to be heard / opportunity to file final pleadings
procedural restart / reprise de la procédure
granting of a deadline to file documents
violation of procedural rules (reglement general de procedure, art. 14)
remedial order by court to cure procedural defect

bodies_of_law_engaged: Administrative procedure (Règlement général de procédure / Conseil d'État practice)
Procedural incidents in civil/administrative litigation (notification defects and procedural restart)
Procedural time limits and deadlines (granting a period to file the final memorandum)
stage2_analysis.retrieval_consideration: Researchers will search for decisions about missing notification of an auditor's/rapporteur's report, remedies requiring reprise de la procédure, and the issuance of a time limit to file the final mémoire under article 14(2) of the Règlement général de procédure.
granularity_decisions: Select A11.3 (Administrative procedure) because the decision applies the Règlement général de procédure and is from the Conseil d'État.
Select A18.1 (Procedural incidents) rather than a broader procedural topic because the teaching addresses a specific incident (missing notification) requiring procedural restart.

Select A18.3 (Time limits and deadlines) because the remedial order specifically grants a new deadline for filing the last mémoire; choose the specific deadlines leaf rather than a generic timing topic.

stage3_materiality.engagement_evidence: Teaching prescribes in-forum mechanics: when an auditor's report was not notified, the procedure must be restarted at the notification stage and parties must be granted a time limit to file the final memorandum.
Teaching interprets the procedural rule (art. 14) to require restarting notification and granting a new deadline when notification failed, i.e. clarifies what the rule requires in this situation.
Teaching orders a judicial remedy addressing a procedural defect: restarting the procedure at notification and granting parties a 30‑day period to file the last memorandum.

production_rules_applied: Topic set includes A18.1 → MUST include B21
Topic set includes A18.3 → MUST include B8 AND B21
